commit_message:
Fixed regression in the RPC module

Code related to RPC that was moved from the API application to the
global RPC module used an invalid type for the version (float instead of
string).

Change-Id: I0f06cc6324065926b8db05d0015a4a689700c557

commit_message:
Make cells Response de/serialize objects

Currently, cells messaging Response lacks the ability to serialize and
deserialize objects. This change adds support so that message methods
in cells/messaging.py are enabled to respond with objects.

Closes-Bug: #1438514

Change-Id: Ie87167bc1cce25e25ffad2214dfe3c78ef830561
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/169165/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_response_to_json_and_from_json(self): response = messaging.Response(self.ctxt, 'child-cell!api-cell', objects.Instance(), False) json_response = response.to_json() deserialized_response = messaging.Response.from_json(self.ctxt, json_response) self.assertIsInstance(deserialized_response.value, objects.Instance)

commit_message:
Set line-height for search-icons

Before, to set correct height of search icons 'top' property of
form-control-feedback class was overriden from default horizon value of
0. This caused other icons in dynamic-ui be incorrectly positioned.

This commit sets line-height for search icons to center the
search icons and not alter any other value.

Change-Id: Ie65a9d4e896be6558fb1137565c2d0afeb720d24
Closes-Bug: #1439024

commit_message:
Log exceptions, raised during api

Before only error stats were updated. This commit adds logging call to
any exception catched during api call execution

Change-Id: I7ead92d27e53ddb5f59fbfcebc7e80b170bdbb18
Closes-Bug: #1435727

commit_message:
Stacktrace on live migration monitoring

If we catch a error during the live migration monitoring we should
stacktrace since this is an unexpected error.

Just add exc_info in order to not change the translated string since we
are in a string freeze.

Change-Id: I75dacb49b1f2881b6030e0e1ac3e577debc4942c
Related-Bug: #1438803

commit_message:
Use new location for atomic images

I applied for a proper group name for Magnum with fedora.  See
infrastructure ticket:

    https://fedorahosted.org/fedora-infrastructure/ticket/4717

This allows serving files from:

    https://fedorapeople.org/groups/magnum/

Closes-Bug: #1442450

Change devtack and documentation accordingly.

Change-Id: I37b005bc50b8045d47c99085ddf8b6b7196a3fa2

commit_message:
Adding log messages to improve error handling

This patch adds log messages, where raised errors
do not propagate to user during resolve build in
functions get_param and get_attr.

Change-Id: I5409f9f9b6542f28b1b5873092ef607949cbc58d

commit_message:
Get members from DB when deleting loadbalancer

When the Load Balancer members are created as a result of autoscaling
groups update or adjust, the reference to the current members is
stored in the database and not in the template. so heat will miss some
members when delete loadbalancer.

Change-Id: Ibcd763b3d73f91b3c09bcf3b5e3162fcf100c3d0
Closes-Bug: #1310602

deleted_lines: for member in self.properties.get(self.MEMBERS): member_id = db_api.resource_data_get(self, member)

added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ========================================= Implement Nova Network resource manager ========================================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/add-nova-network-resource-manager It will adds Nova Network resource manager in heat. Problem description =================== There is no Nova Network resource in heat, if user config 'network_api_class=nova.network.API', or if user doesn't deploy neutron, user can't manage network resource, therefore, the operates which related with network can't works, for example user can't create server with network. So we should support the Nova Network resource in heat. Proposed change =============== 1. Add 'OS::Nova::Network' resource. Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <huangtianhua> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-2 Work Items ---------- 1. Add 'OS::Nova::Network' resource 2. Add UT/Tempest for the change 3. Add a template for OS::Nova::Network resource Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint neutron-grouppolicy

Heat resources for neutron group based policy API

Change-Id: If409fadcc969c7d5c5d59d3a5c29ac81788705eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/17/111417/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================== Support for neutron grouppolicy resources =========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/neutron-grouppolicy Add support for neutron group based policy resources in heat. Problem description =================== Openstack networking is being extended with policy and connectivity abstractions to enable simplified application oriented interfaces. The resources include policy and connectivity abstractions. Proposed change =============== Adding the following neutron resources to heat: Endpoint Endpoint-Group L3Policy L2Policy Policy-Actions Policy-Classifiers Policy-Rules Contracts Contract-Scopes Filters Capabilities Roles Selectors Policy-Labels Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Susaant Kondapaneni (susaant) Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-3 Work Items ---------- 1. Implement resources for Endpoint, EndpointGroup, L3Policy and L2Policy 2. Implement resources for Policy-Actions, Policy-Rules and Policy-classifiers 3. Implement resources for Contracts, Contract-Scopes, Policy-Labels 4. Implement resources for Filters, Selectors, Capabilities, Roles Dependencies ============ - [1] Group-based policy abstractions: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/89469

commit_message:
Add --preview option to stack abandon command

Option --preview is used to get abandon data without deleting the
stack. It's very useful to perform dry run abandon before stack update
to get a copy of healthy data for later adopt if update failure found.

Partical-Bug: #1300830
Change-Id: Ie3f0d15c1841e22825bb203e455e93d9f9ca2495
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/80/84680/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Implements neutron group based policy resources

This is the first in a series of patches which implement
resources for neutron group policy APIs.

This patch implements four new resources:
 - Endpoint
 - EndpointGroup
 - L2-Policy
 - L3-Policy

Implements: blueprint neutron-grouppolicy

Change-Id: Ifa7372c3a1fefadafb74718ea3ff1c48c0d48c4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/19/111419/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy from neutronclient.v2_0 import client as neutronclient from heat.common import exception from heat.common import template_format from heat.engine import scheduler from heat.engine.resources.neutron import grouppolicy from heat.tests.common import HeatTestCase from heat.tests import utils endpoint_template = ''' { "AWSTemplateFormatVersion" : "2010-09-09", "Description" : "Template to test neutron endpoint resource", "Parameters" : {}, "Resources" : { "endpoint": { "Type": "OS::Neutron::Endpoint", "Properties": { "name": "test-endpoint", "endpoint_group_id": "epg-id", "description": "test endpoint resource" } } } } ''' endpoint_group_template = ''' { "AWSTemplateFormatVersion" : "2010-09-09", "Description" : "Template to test neutron endpoint group resource", "Parameters" : {}, "Resources" : { "endpoint_group": { "Type": "OS::Neutron::EndpointGroup", "Properties": { "name": "test-endpoint-group", "description": "test endpoint group resource", "l2_policy_id": "l2-policy-id", "provided_contracts": [ {"contract_id": "contract1", "contract_scope": "scope1"}, {"contract_id": "contract2", "contract_scope": "scope2"} ], "consumed_contracts": [ {"contract_id": "contract3", "contract_scope": "scope3"}, {"contract_id": "contract4", "contract_scope": "scope4"} ] } } } } ''' l2_policy_template = ''' { "AWSTemplateFormatVersion" : "2010-09-09", "Description" : "Template to test neutron l2 policy", "Parameters" : {}, "Resources" : { "l2_policy": { "Type": "OS::Neutron::L2Policy", "Properties": { "name": "test-l2-policy", "description": "test L2 policy resource", "l3_policy_id": "l3-policy-id" } } } } ''' l3_policy_template = ''' { "AWSTemplateFormatVersion" : "2010-09-09", "Description" : "Template to test neutron l3 policy", "Parameters" : {}, "Resources" : { "l3_policy": { "Type": "OS::Neutron::L3Policy", "Properties": { "name": "test-l3-policy", "description": "test L3 policy resource", "ip_version": "4", "ip_pool": "10.20.20.0", "subnet_prefix_length": 24 } } } } ''' class EndpointTest(HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(EndpointTest, self).setUp() self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'create_endpoint') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'delete_endpoint') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'show_endpoint') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'update_endpoint') self.stub_keystoneclient() def create_endpoint(self): neutronclient.Client.create_endpoint({ 'endpoint': { 'name': 'test-endpoint', 'endpoint_group_id': 'epg-id', "description": "test endpoint resource" } }).AndReturn({'endpoint': {'id': '5678'}}) snippet = template_format.parse(endpoint_template) stack = utils.parse_stack(snippet) resource_defns = stack.t.resource_definitions(stack) return grouppolicy.Endpoint( 'endpoint', resource_defns['endpoint'], stack) def test_create(self): rsrc = self.create_endpoint() self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() self.assertEqual((rsrc.CREATE, rsrc.COMPLETE), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_create_failed(self): neutronclient.Client.create_endpoint({ 'endpoint': { 'name': 'test-endpoint', 'endpoint_group_id': 'epg-id', "description": "test endpoint resource" } }).AndRaise(grouppolicy.NeutronClientException()) self.m.ReplayAll() snippet = template_format.parse(endpoint_template) stack = utils.parse_stack(snippet) resource_defns = stack.t.resource_definitions(stack) rsrc = grouppolicy.Endpoint( 'endpoint', resource_defns['endpoint'], stack) error = self.assertRaises(exception.ResourceFailure, scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)) self.assertEqual( 'NeutronClientException: An unknown exception occurred.', str(error)) self.assertEqual((rsrc.CREATE, rsrc.FAILED), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_delete(self): neutronclient.Client.delete_endpoint('5678') neutronclient.Client.show_endpoint('5678').AndRaise( grouppolicy.NeutronClientException(status_code=404)) rsrc = self.create_endpoint() self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.delete)() self.assertEqual((rsrc.DELETE, rsrc.COMPLETE), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_delete_already_gone(self): neutronclient.Client.delete_endpoint('5678').AndRaise( grouppolicy.NeutronClientException(status_code=404)) rsrc = self.create_endpoint() self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.delete)() self.assertEqual((rsrc.DELETE, rsrc.COMPLETE), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_delete_failed(self): neutronclient.Client.delete_endpoint('5678').AndRaise( grouppolicy.NeutronClientException(status_code=400)) rsrc = self.create_endpoint() self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() error = self.assertRaises(exception.ResourceFailure, scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.delete)) self.assertEqual( 'NeutronClientException: An unknown exception occurred.', str(error)) self.assertEqual((rsrc.DELETE, rsrc.FAILED), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_attribute(self): rsrc = self.create_endpoint() neutronclient.Client.show_endpoint('5678').MultipleTimes( ).AndReturn( {'endpoint': {'neutron_port_id': '1234'}}) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() self.assertEqual('1234', rsrc.FnGetAtt('neutron_port_id')) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_attribute_failed(self): rsrc = self.create_endpoint() self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() error = self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidTemplateAttribute, rsrc.FnGetAtt, 'l2_policy_id') self.assertEqual( 'The Referenced Attribute (endpoint l2_policy_id) is ' 'incorrect.', str(error)) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_update(self): rsrc = self.create_endpoint() neutronclient.Client.update_endpoint( '5678', {'endpoint': {'endpoint_group_id': 'epg_id_update'}}) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() update_template = copy.deepcopy(rsrc.t) update_template['Properties']['endpoint_group_id'] = 'epg_id_update' scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.update, update_template)() self.m.VerifyAll() class EndpointGroupTest(HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(EndpointGroupTest, self).setUp() self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'create_endpoint_group') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'delete_endpoint_group') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'show_endpoint_group') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'update_endpoint_group') self.stub_keystoneclient() def create_endpoint_group(self): neutronclient.Client.create_endpoint_group({ "endpoint_group": { "name": "test-endpoint-group", "description": "test endpoint group resource", "l2_policy_id": "l2-policy-id", "provided_contracts": { "contract1": "scope1", "contract2": "scope2" }, "consumed_contracts": { "contract3": "scope3", "contract4": "scope4" } } }).AndReturn({'endpoint_group': {'id': '5678'}}) snippet = template_format.parse(endpoint_group_template) stack = utils.parse_stack(snippet) resource_defns = stack.t.resource_definitions(stack) return grouppolicy.EndpointGroup( 'endpoint_group', resource_defns['endpoint_group'], stack) def test_create(self): rsrc = self.create_endpoint_group() self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() self.assertEqual((rsrc.CREATE, rsrc.COMPLETE), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_create_failed(self): neutronclient.Client.create_endpoint_group({ "endpoint_group": { "name": "test-endpoint-group", "description": "test endpoint group resource", "l2_policy_id": "l2-policy-id", "provided_contracts": { "contract1": "scope1", "contract2": "scope2" }, "consumed_contracts": { "contract3": "scope3", "contract4": "scope4" } } }).AndRaise(grouppolicy.NeutronClientException()) self.m.ReplayAll() snippet = template_format.parse(endpoint_group_template) stack = utils.parse_stack(snippet) resource_defns = stack.t.resource_definitions(stack) rsrc = grouppolicy.EndpointGroup( 'endpoint_group', resource_defns['endpoint_group'], stack) error = self.assertRaises(exception.ResourceFailure, scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)) self.assertEqual( 'NeutronClientException: An unknown exception commit_message:
Group policy API-2 resources: Classifiers, Actions and Rules

This is the second patch in the Group Policy resources implementation
series. This patch implements:
Policy Classifiers
Policy Actions
Policy Rules

In the context of larger Group Policy model, the Policy Rule resource
is referenced by Contracts, which will be introduced in the subsequent
patch.

Change-Id: Iaff15a534f7ac6b979c8b783907705406ee2cbb2
Implements: blueprint neutron-grouppolicy

commit_message:
Group Policy API-3: Contracts

This is the third patch in the Group Policy resources implementation
series. This patch implements:
Contracts

In the context of larger Group Policy model, Contracts contain Policy
Rules and Endpoint Groups consume or provide Contracts.

Change-Id: If12f966ac360d2dd9f459d720fc4114e7ffc6e9e

subject: validate a invalid number_typed parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-29 08:14:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_validate.py', 'heat/engine/parameters.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/ca5658f4d8730625ed1c0355eca77bf05194a20f', 'message': "validate a invalid number_typed parameter

if input a invalid string (i.e.'aaaa') to a number type parameter
heat will raise a ERROR but create the stack sucessfully.
Because other operations like stack-list will parse existing stack again,
these operations will fail and lead strange behavior to heat user.

Change-Id: Ifbf266a595a0cbe1f8f4990757ca83a456f2b997
Closes-bug: #1321549
"}]
commit_message:
validate a invalid number_typed parameter

if input a invalid string (i.e.'aaaa') to a number type parameter
heat will raise a ERROR but create the stack sucessfully.
Because other operations like stack-list will parse existing stack again,
these operations will fail and lead strange behavior to heat user.

Change-Id: Ifbf266a595a0cbe1f8f4990757ca83a456f2b997
Closes-bug: #1321549

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-23 20:26:12.000000000', 'files': ['etc/heat/heat.conf.sample', 'heat/common/crypt.py', 'heat/tests/test_common_crypt.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/b9d803c0b015a4283eb123959100fbf81638b487', 'message': 'Require at least 8 chars for auth_encryption_key

If a custom auth_encryption_key is set, and the custom

to 32 chars. Add tests.

Change-Id: I6c461416d9889165af0eb003e5903bc188156464
'}]
commit_message:
Require at least 8 chars for auth_encryption_key

If a custom auth_encryption_key is set, and the custom
key is less than 32 chars, the encryption/decryption
fails with a trace. We can however easily pad it
to 32 chars. Add tests.

Change-Id: I6c461416d9889165af0eb003e5903bc188156464

commit_message:
Adds multi-cloud to OS::Heat::Stack resource

Adds more properties you can specify in context
to allow creating stack resource in other cloud.
Added properties:
* username
* password
* tenant_name
* auth_url

Change-Id: Ibe35d0b92d523449416a7db8afcf7e96bf593341
Implements: blueprint multi-region-support

If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ============================= New plugin to orchestrate CloudSigma cloud resources ============================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/cloudsigma-plugin A plugin to orchestrate CoudSigma resources from Heat. This enables the orchestration of hybrid OpenStack+CloudSigma or pure CloudSigma templates. Problem description =================== A company that has OpenStack deployment can burst to the CloudSigma cloud. The plugin enables managing of instances/drives/networks[public,vlan] Proposed change =============== We have created the plugin and want to contribute it to the OpenStack project. The plugin will reside in heat/contrib/cloudsigma Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- <StoyanAtanasov> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-2 Work Items ---------- * Add the plugin to the project Dependencies ============ pycloudsigma https://github.com/cloudsigma/pycloudsigma

Change-Id: I7fbe6d773e8ea01fb819692f0ff587783cd7192d

commit_message:
Title:Heat to assert the states of the server

Heat today does not assert the state of the Server that is provisioned from the Heat template. I propose Heat to assert the states of the server in order to be able to update or add to the configuration of the heat template at any given point of time and from/to any state of the Server

Change-Id: I7fbe6d773e8ea01fb819692f0ff587783cd7192d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/35/111235/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================================== Heat to assert the state of the servers ======================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/heat-assert-state-server Problem description =================== Heat today does not assert the state of the Server that is provisioned from the Heat template and therefore whatever changes that are done to the instances are not known to Heat. So, if there is an add/update configuration to an existing Heat template, it is likely to fail as the Server would not be in a desirable state. Proposed change =============== I propose Heat to assert the state of the server in order to be able to update or add to the configuration of the heat template at any given point of time and in any state of the Server. It will be useful when one wants to have the server that performs backups stopped while it is not doing anything. The workflow would be [set backup server to active]--[run backups]--[set backup server to stop] A tenant admin or user likes to schedule creation of instances/life cycle operations on instances like power on and power off. It helps in a scenario where there are instances of both night shift and dayshift employees in a particular tenant. During the day, the tenant admin does not want the night shift employee instances to be up and the admin wants to schedule them to be power off/suspend so that he saves on power and utilization cost or the tenant admin could trigger a snapshot of all the night shift employee instances to save their work and schedule a boot from snapshot the next night. Implementation ============== Heat knows and tracks the default active/fail state for a server. When any server instance is created it either goes to an active state or a fail state and after that whatever instance state like powered on, powered off, suspended, resumed etc.. are not known or tracked by HEAT. So, the implementation would be to get the current state of the server from Nova and feed it into the Heat server properties and use them to change the state from active to power on or power off or something else on a Heat template update or reconfiguration. Each state change can be used as a trigger points for a useful workflow can be attached to it. Dependencies ============ Heat will dependent on Nova to get the current state of the Server at any given point of time.

commit_message:
Kubernetes pod resources for container management

A config and deployment resource to support kubernetes(k8s) pods
(a colocated group of 'docker' containers with shared
volumes).

Change-Id: I323d829829e7a09b0be25af508aac933f2b87b20
Specifies: bp k8s-container-pod-resources
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/17/130117/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================================== Kubernetes Pod Resources for managing containers with Heat =========================================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/k8s-container-pod-config-resource Containers are becoming popular and docker has become an important part of how new services are build and deployed with container technology. Kubernetes(k8s) is an open source system for managing containerized applications across multiple hosts, providing basic mechanisms for deployment, maintenance, and scaling of applications. Kubelet, a k8s component, is a container agent that runs on nodes and works with container manifests. A container manifest is a YAML configuration that describes a pod. Kubelet agent running on each node takes a manifests (describing multiple pods) that can be provided in various (file/http url/etcd) mechanisms and ensures that the containers described in those manifests are started and continue running. Heat can support container deployments and their lifecycle management by leveraging the Kubelet container agent. A pod models an application-specific "logical host"in a containerized environment. It may contain one or more containers which are relatively tightly coupled. Pods correspond to colocated groups of [Docker containers](http://docker.io) with shared volumes, as supported by [Google Cloud Platform's container-vm images] (https://developers.google.com/compute/docs/containers) Problem description =================== Heat should support container deployemnt and their lifecycle management, the same way it manages other openstack resources and software configurations. Proposed change =============== To solve this problem following changes are proposed: a. Implement a k8s pod configuration resource, that describes a container manifest. This can be extended in the future to include other k8s models like 'services' and 'replicationContollers'.Sets of pods may created, maintained, and scaled using 'replicationControllers' and 'services' create load-balanced targets for sets of pods. b. Implement a k8s pod deployment resource, that associates a pod configuration with an instance. c. Implement a hook that deploys/updates a pod config for Kubelet and updates its status by quering it from k8s and signals heat. Creation of pod is currently not idempotent. There is plan to add a modification token to each resource in kubernetes that can be used to identify duplicates. Resource configuration that can then be used by Kubelet in instance agent to manage the containers in the spawned instance. The container maanifest can be made available to kubelet using 1. An in-instance configuration file referred by Kubelet 2. Signed heat url 3. Swift temp url Possiblil of using 1 & 2 are remote as they are temporary in nature and kubelet config requires the config to exist for it's lifetime. d. All lifecycle operations on the resource would change this configuration and Kubelet agent would reflect that change by creating, removing and updating the pods. Alternatives ------------ An alternate solution with sofware config/structured config has already been implemented. However, this can't manage lifecycle operations for the pods. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- ramishra Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-1 Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============

commit_message:
Encryption/decryption of sections in a HOT template.

For security, licensing and other reasons it is desirable
to have encryption capability enabling free exchange of HOT
sections while still ensuring that only the intended parties
can use them.

Change-Id: Ib5b7ebc56f1c69bcd282cc5831599bd818972b8b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/31/99931/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== Encryption/decryption of sections in a HOT template =================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/hot-section-encryption https://review.openstack.org/#/c/99930 A way for enabling free exchange of HOT resources while ensuring that only the intended parties can use them. Problem description =================== For security, licensing and other reasons it is desirable to have encryption capability enabling free exchange of HOT sections while still ensuring that only the intended parties can use them. The different schemes of HOT encryption are shown below. - Property encryption – applies to a section property (e.g. user_data of OS::Nova::Server) - Resource encryption – applies to a complete resource section (e.g. OS::Heat::AutoscalingPolicy) Proposed change =============== **Examples of the template format** Applied to a property:: resources: database: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: flavor: {get_param: database_flavor} image: {get_param: image} key_name: {get_param: key} metadata: {enc: [4BEzrT18dxdisIKFPkw7k0SB/hKcT80VawodxuwT, AES]} availability_zone: {enc:8dEzrv18dxdcT80Vawow9f0SB/hKcwow7k0SBxuwu} user_data: str_replace: template: | {enc: [8dEzrv18dxdcT80Vawow9f0SB/hKcwow7k0SBxuwu, AES_SP]} params: $db_rootpassword: {get_attr: [database_root_password, value]} $db_name: {get_param: database_name} $db_user: {get_param: database_user} $db_password: {get_attr: [database_password, value]} Applied to a full section:: web_server_scaleup_policy: type: OS::Heat::ScalingPolicy properties: {enc: [1BVzrT18dxWisIKUPkq9k0SB/aKcT70VawodxucI, AES_SP]} Here the "enc" intrinsic function shows that the encrypted string should be decrypted upon deployment. The first item is the actual string. The second item refers to an existing algorithm that Heat can use to decrypt encrypted properties, or property sections. **The decryption algorithm** The default decryption method applied when loading a HOT template can be AES-256-CFB. However it should be possible to choose another decryption algorithm from the list of implemented algorithms or implement a custom one. The algorithms used in a HOT template must be available in the Heat Engine for successful decryption and deployment. If for some reason the algorithm is not present stack deployment should abort. Note that depending on the parts of the HOT template that have been encrypted, the Heat Engine may not validate the template until decrypted. **Encryption** A template editor should encrypt all the necessary properties or resource sections before deployment. The encryption process must use the same algorithms as the ones specified in the sections of a HOT template file. Usage of multiple algorithms per template is allowed. This process can be performed either manually (for each property to encrypt) or with help of a GUI. Encryption must be done with the same secret (license) key as the one supplied to the Heat Engine (cli or Horizon) upon deployment (i.e. in the environment file). Work Items ========== The following work items have been identified: #. Implementation of the 'enc' function #. Support for multiple encryption algorithms #. Encryption/decryption implementation #. The API for supporting encryption/decryption #. Changes in the python-heatclient

commit_message:
HAaaS Specification

Base spec for High Availability as a service in heat. This will contain
main design and architecture of system, and contain sub-specs for each
subsystem

Specifies https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/haaas-heat-resource

Change-Id: I955bd55554fae68165d30ce2965c32ca4decba5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/51/120051/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================== Heat High Availability as a service =================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/haaas-heat-resource Problem's description: ====================== Currently OpenStack does not have a built-in HA mechanism for tenant instances which could restore virtual machines in case of a host failure. Openstack assumes every app is designed for failure and can handle instance failure and will self-remediate, but that is rarely the case for the very large Enterprise application ecosystem. Many existing enterprise applications are stateful, and assume that the physical infrastructure is always on. Even the OpenStack controller services themselves do not gracefully handle failure (heat is one of examples). When these applications were virtualized, they were virtualized on platforms that enabled very high SLAs for each virtual machine, allowing the application to not be rewritten as the IT team moved them from physical to virtual. Now while these apps cannot benefit from methods like automatic scaleout, the application owners will greatly benefit from the self-service capabilities they will recieve as they utilize the OpenStack control plane. This proposal is to rewrite the heat HARestarter in a way that, apart from its current features, will allow VMs to be restarted in case of host failure. This subsystem will be plugin-based so it will allow using both hypervisor capabilities and several approaches in case the hypervisor is unable to provide HA by itself. Prior discussion: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/openstack-instance-high-availability https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/evacuate-host https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/find-host-and-evacuate-instance https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/unify-migrate-and-live-migrate https://etherpad.openstack.org/HavanaUnifyMigrateAndLiveMigrate https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/live-migration-scheduling http://openstacksummitapril2013.sched.org/event/92e3468e458c13616331e75f15685560#.UXUeVXyuiw4 https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/live-migration-scheduling https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/evacuate-instance-automatically https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/rhev-m-ovirt-clusters-as-compute-resources [1] http://it20.info/2012/12/vcloud-openstack-pets-and-cattle/ General architecture: ===================== In the core of the system there will be the process HAEngine which will listen on queue for any incoming host-down-messages and, if it gets one, it will act using the logic from the configured plugin. Process HAWatchdog will be running on cloud controller and it will post host-down-messages when process HAWatchdogAgent (on compute nodes) fails to post heartbeat. Heat API will provide RESTful API for both system configuration and host-down posting (this logic can also be put into heat api). Then there will be plugins with vm restarting logic. Current plugin list looks as follows(might be changed and expanded): * Simple restart plugin This will be equivalent to current HARestart mechanism, so simply restarting VM in case of alarm. * Boot from shared storage If there is shared storage configured and VMs are boot from volume, in case of alarms this plugin will boot vm from its file on another host. (simpliest approach would be to use boot from volume mechanism) * DRBD Works much like shared storage plugin, but uses DRBD to manage vm files on different hosts. * VCenter HA mangement Some hypervisors (like VCenter) provide its own HA mechanism - in this case we will simply enable it for given VM. * Custom Since it will be plugin-based, a client will be able to write his own logic. We should make it configurable per-vm or per-host-aggregate since we migh want to have hybrid clouds behave differently or to append different level of SLA on specific VMs. +------------+ | HA plugin | +------+-----+ | | +------------+ +------+-----+ +-----------+ | | | | | Watchdog | | Heat API +---+ HAEngine | | Agents | | | | | +----+------+ +-----+------+ +------+-----+ | | | +----+------+ | | | Heartbeat | | | | Queue | | +-----+-----+ +----+------+ | | | | | | Alarm | +-----+------+ +-----------+ Queue +-----+ HAWatchdog | | | +------------+ +-----------+ Enabling HA on VM ================= In heat template we can create resource called HighAvailability and as configuration it will take pointer to vm, plugin we want to use and any other configuration we might need (alternatively we could write some sort of UI for it). Starting this template would configure HA according to the plugin provided. For example, it will connect VM with its host and the file located on shared storage for future restarts. Due to many apps now being written to be cloud aware and designed for failure, we would want to ensure that the tenant can specify which of their resources should restart, and which should not. This would be important to configure at instance level since some parts of the heat template would have instances that should not be restarted in order to minimize issues with app level self-remediation. Alarms ====== We should investigate and support several alarm providers which would allow for low latency alerting/decisions as well as flexibility for different implementations. * HAWatchdog Specific heartbeat mechanism for HA * Nova heartbeat Using Nova zookeeper heartbeat * Api Client may be able to set up their own mechanism which will work well in specific environment Development phases ================== We want to develop features in this order: 1. Shared storage boot This will provide quickest way to enable HA on Live migration able deployments. At this time we will have to implement first heartbeat as well. 2. Ceilometer alarm integration, additional plugins Ceilometer alarms will allow us to add much wider spectrum of symptoms which could affect our cloud. We will also develop additional plugins to cover variety of cloud deployments and infrastructure configurations. 3:*. Pluings, alarm sources Evolve and expand

commit_message:
Automatically pull all element READMEs into docs

This adds a tiny sphinx extension that runs a shell script that copies
(with modifications) each element's README.rst into the doc tree.

The elements symlink is deleted; this is no longer required, as the
directory is recreated each time the docs job is run.

Change-Id: I1d2c6b5021cdeb00eb6e3a13c8a56d5b7ee94154

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os from sphinx import errors def builder_inited(app): app.info('In: ' + os.path.abspath('.')) source_dir = app.srcdir build_dir = app.outdir app.info('Generating element docs from %s into %s' % (source_dir, build_dir)) ret = os.system('bin/prepare-readmes') if ret: raise errors.ExtensionError( "Error generating docs in %s" % build_dir) def setup(app): app.connect('builder-inited', builder_inited)

commit_message:
Add a vlan check

Adds a vlan check job for TripleO

This is intended to be used for testing new public-IP functionality.

This patchset partially completes a spec which will one day live at
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+specs/tripleo-juno-virtual-public-ips
but for now can bee seen in  Id9addc65f0d2ed519ce4b3edbd561ed660a2786e.

The details of the public VIP - including vlan tags, interface names,
network ranges and so on - are assumed to be provided in $TE_DATAFILE
but not activated by default.

Change-Id: I0f9e4cd4dfca3e7baae747255bc84e6efd52bcd2
Requires: I231c0aaff787c8dd88f50587b6a5cdf9c9e63b0f
Requires: I78c0fa3902c1e480b7ada0055332b14828c3c7f9

commit_message:
No need to create APIVersionRequest every time

APIVersionRequest will be created everytime when the microversion
is used. Actually we can create them once and used later.

Change-Id: I5d62003b87b85bc5020fe32788d255bc7273a9c9

commit_message:
auth_encryption_key is being checked to be 16, 24, or 32

If auth_encryption_key length is not 16 or 24 or 32 in that case
heat operations such as stack-creates fails. This check has been
added.

Change-Id: Ic653d18dbb7523ca5286ae0951eb86ad72cbdb13
Closes-bug: #1415887
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/79/168779/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auth_key_len = strlen(cfg.CONF.auth_encryption_key) if auth_key_len not in [16, 24, 32]: raise exception.Error(_('heat.conf misconfigured, auth_encryption_key ' 'length must be 16, 24 or 32'))

commit_message:
Add a "show_hidden" parameter to stack-list API

Passing "show_hidden=True" will result in hidden stacks being shown in
the stack listing.

blueprint stack-tags

Change-Id: I3074282131443c8e3894f9ce9e363a4438f5a11e

commit_message:
Add ability to hide stacks based on tag

Add a "hidden_stack_tags" option that contains a list of tag names.
Stacks that have one or more of these tags will be hidden.

Add an option to show hidden stacks in the stack listing.

blueprint stack-tags

Change-Id: I45a5ac6d73a9a61629a56f88270e3a97fafb378a

commit_message:
Database API and engine changes for stack tags

Allow tagging of stacks with simple string tags.

blueprint stack-tags

Change-Id: I65e1e8e87515595edae332c2ff7e0e82ded409ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/50/159250/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'tags': None, def test_tags_extract(self): p = {'tags': ["tag1", "tag2"]} args = api.extract_args(p) self.assertEqual(['tag1', 'tag2'], args['tags']) def test_tags_extract_not_present(self): args = api.extract_args({}) self.assertNotIn('tags', args) def test_tags_extract_not_map(self): p = {'tags': {"foo": "bar"}} exc = self.assertRaises(ValueError, api.extract_args, p) self.assertIn('Invalid tags, not a list: ', six.text_type(exc)) def test_tags_extract_not_string(self): p = {'tags': ["tag1", 2]} exc = self.assertRaises(ValueError, api.extract_args, p) self.assertIn('Invalid tag, "2" is not a string', six.text_type(exc)) def test_tags_extract_comma(self): p = {'tags': ["tag1", 'tag2,']} exc = self.assertRaises(ValueError, api.extract_args, p) self.assertIn('Invalid tag, "tag2," contains a comma', six.text_type(exc))

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Add Configuration Step Unit Tests

This patch adds unit tests for the configuration step.  These tests are focused
around the controller and its related components (no selenium tests or view
tests).

Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully <brian.tully@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shaoquan Chen <sean.chen2@hp.com>
Change-Id: Ic25a36ca598459cce4a577da0a99175fbcd1d27a
Partial-Bug: 1435869
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/23/167323/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: describe('Primary Controller', function() { var scope, ctrl; beforeEach(module('hz.dashboard.launch-instance')); beforeEach(inject(function($controller) { scope = {model: { newInstanceSpec: {}, }}; ctrl = $controller('LaunchInstanceConfigurationCtrl', {$scope:scope}); })); }); describe('Help Controller', function() { var scope, ctrl; beforeEach(module('hz.dashboard.launch-instance')); beforeEach(inject(function($controller) { scope = {}; ctrl = $controller('LaunchInstanceConfigurationHelpCtrl', {$scope:scope}); })); it('defines the title', function() { expect(scope.title).toBeDefined(); }); });

commit_message:
Deprecate using required=True with default value

The current schema of constraints allow to use default values for
required=True. However we never use it except in unittests, because
user should set it always, which looks like not required property.
This patch adds checking for constraint schema class with warning
message.

Change-Id: Ic6ace30742e887069f119a14ffb091f6bac9e682

added_lines: if required and default is not None: raise exception.InvalidSchemaError( message=_('Option required=True should not be used with ' 'default value'))

commit_message:
Make disk property of flavor default

DISK property of NovaFlavor resource is ambiguous: it is required
and it has default value. The property has been changed to
default only (to support compatibility and not break
existing templates). In addition, added test that check resources
about amibigious property definition.

Change-Id: I51be18b7201e78d6af261f678ddf440aa0fa893e
Closes-bug: #1436331

commit_message:
Fix a issue for kafka-publisher and refactor the test code

Fix a issue which causes error when default policy is selected.
Add test codes to avoid the same mistakes again.
Fix a bug of the test code which is:
* KafkaBrokerPublisher tries to connect localhost when __init__
  is called because of the lack of mocking _get_client function
  before initializing KafkaBrokerPublisher.

Closes-Bug: 1441175
Closes-Bug: 1441258
Change-Id: I306db443a866860ee45b2362b8a0cd2a59d8c3a2

added_lines: Release Procedure ================= 1. Create a tag for the new release and push it to gerrit [#tagging_a_release]_ . Infra machinary will take care of the rest and automatically upload the release to PyPI. 2. Bump the version in setup.cfg. This opens the development for the next release. .. [#tagging_a_release] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#tagging-a-release

commit_message:
Fix here-document usage

Use tabs instead of whitespace to indent lines of the here-document. Tabs
indent the text properly in the shell script and are omitted from the output.
Otherwise, running the shell script produces this error:

./prepare_devstack.sh: line 30: warning: here-document at line 21 delimited by
end-of-file (wanted `EOF')
./prepare_devstack.sh: line 31: syntax error: unexpected end of file

Change-Id: I893cd43dfbebd751b0ad5fb3ffff188c40fc862e

Partially Implements: blueprint horizon-create-policies

Change-Id: Ib989d6a45e55d208e131f451f78820da8ce51eed

* create.html: Contains modal form to create a new policy.

commit_message:
Create policy via Horizon

* congress.py: New API function to create a policy.

policies/
* forms.py: Form to create a policy.
* tables.py: Move code for listing a policy's rules in a table to a new module,
  keeping the rules code separate. Add new button to create a policy.

policies/rules/
* __init__.py: Separate out rules code into its own module.
* tables.py: Moved rules code from policies/table.py to here.
* urls.py: Add new url for policy creation.
* views.py: Add new view for policy creation. Get PolicyRulesTable from new
  rules module. Add more logging.

policies/templates/policies/
* _create.html: Form to create a new policy.
* create.html: Contains modal form to create a new policy.
* policies_table.html, policy_rules_table.html: Remove unused templates.

Partially implements blueprint: horizon-create-policies

Change-Id: I93337d0d47a94c13960a7fa69aa97edec8615f9b

commit_message:
Split net and subnet tests to different files

- templates were updated
- re-use netron_template for defining deprecation template

Change-Id: I15e1dc9833cd18327baa05f0ddc63e9af71a1dec

test_null_gateway_ip(self): p = {} subnet.Subnet._null_gateway_ip(p) self.assertEqual({}, p) p = {'foo': 'bar'} subnet.Subnet._null_gateway_ip(p) self.assertEqual({'foo': 'bar'}, p) p = { 'foo': 'bar', 'gateway_ip': '198.51.100.0' } subnet.Subnet._null_gateway_ip(p) self.assertEqual({ 'foo': 'bar', 'gateway_ip': '198.51.100.0' }, p) p = { 'foo': 'bar', 'gateway_ip': '' } mox.IsA(neutronclient.Client), 'network', 'None' ).AndReturn('None') neutronclient.Client.create_subnet({ 'subnet': { 'name': utils.PhysName('test_stack', 'test_subnet'), 'network_id': u'None', 'ipv6_ra_mode': 'slaac' } }).AndReturn({ "subnet": { "allocation_pools": [ {"start": "fdfa:6a50:d22b::2", "end": "fdfa:6a50:d22b:0:ffff:ffff:ffff:fffe"}], "cidr": "fd00:1::/64", "enable_dhcp": True, "c1210485b2424d48804aad5d39c61b8f", 'ipv6_address_mode': 'slaac', 'ipv6_ra_mode': 'slaac' } }) self.m.ReplayAll() t = template_format.parse(neutron_template) props = t['Resources']['subnet']['Properties'] props.pop('allocation_pools') props.pop('host_routes') props['ip_version'] = 6 props['ipv6_address_mode'] = 'slaac' props['ipv6_ra_mode'] = 'slaac' props['cidr'] = 'fdfa:6a50:d22b::/64' props['dns_nameservers'] = ['2001:4860:4860::8844'] stack = utils.parse_stack(t) rsrc = self.create_subnet(t, stack, 'subnet') scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() self.assertEqual((rsrc.CREATE, rsrc.COMPLETE), rsrc.state) rsrc.validate() self.m.VerifyAll() def test_ipv6_validate_ra_mode(self): t = template_format.parse(neutron_template) props = t['Resources']['subnet']['Properties'] props['ipv6_address_mode'] = 'dhcpv6-stateful' props['ipv6_ra_mode'] = 'slaac' props['ip_version'] = 6 stack = utils.parse_stack(t) rsrc = stack['subnet'] ex = self.assertRaises(exception.StackValidationFailed, rsrc.validate) self.assertEqual("When both ipv6_ra_mode and ipv6_address_mode are " "set, they must be equal.", six.text_type(ex)) def test_ipv6_validate_ip_version(self): t = template_format.parse(neutron_template) props = t['Resources']['subnet']['Properties'] props['ipv6_address_mode'] = 'slaac' props['ipv6_ra_mode'] = 'slaac' props['ip_version'] = 4 stack = utils.parse_stack(t) rsrc = stack['subnet'] ex = self.assertRaises(exception.StackValidationFailed, rsrc.validate) self.assertEqual("ipv6_ra_mode and ipv6_address_mode are not " "supported for ipv4.", six.text_type(ex))

commit_message:
publish policy table result to dse bus

This patch implements subscriptions for the policy engine. That is,
every time someone subscribes to a policy engine table, the policy
engine will publish the results of that table on the message bus.

Implements blueprint: publish-policy-results-to-bus

Change-Id: I8161d233e64a9bff5d4fa31c02b368a5ef75c878

added_lines: import mockclass VersionNegotiationMixinTest(utils.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(VersionNegotiationMixinTest, self).setUp() self.test_object = http.VersionNegotiationMixin() self.test_object.os_ironic_api_version = 1.6 self.test_object.implicit_api_version = True self.mock_mcu = mock.MagicMock() self.test_object._make_connection_url = self.mock_mcu def test__parse_version_headers_has_headers(self): response = {'X-OpenStack-Ironic-API-Minimum-Version': 1.1, 'X-OpenStack-Ironic-API-Maximum-Version': 1.6, } expected = (1.1, 1.6) result = self.test_object._parse_version_headers(response.get) self.assertEqual(expected, result) def test__parse_version_headers_missing_headers(self): response = {} expected = (None, None) result = self.test_object._parse_version_headers(response.get) self.assertEqual(expected, result) def test__make_simple_request_with_accessor(self): accessor_func = mock.MagicMock() conn = mock.MagicMock() result = self.test_object._make_simple_request( conn, 'get', 'http://www.example.com/', accessor_func=accessor_func) self.assertTrue(self.mock_mcu.called) self.assertTrue(conn.getresponse.called) self.mock_mcu.assert_called_with('http://www.example.com/') def test__make_simple_request_no_accessor(self): conn = mock.MagicMock() result = self.test_object._make_simple_request( conn, 'get', 'http://www.example.com/') self.assertTrue(conn.getresponse.called) self.assertFalse(self.mock_mcu.called) @mock.patch.object(http.VersionNegotiationMixin, '_parse_version_headers', autospec=True) def test_negotiate_version_server_older(self, mock_pvh): mock_pvh.return_value = (1.1, 1.5) conn = mock.MagicMock() resp = None result = self.test_object.negotiate_version(conn, resp) self.assertEqual(1.5, result) @mock.patch.object(http.VersionNegotiationMixin, '_parse_version_headers', autospec=True) def test_negotiate_version_server_newer(self, mock_pvh): mock_pvh.return_value = (1.1, 99.99) conn = mock.MagicMock() resp = None result = self.test_object.negotiate_version(conn, resp) self.assertEqual(1.6, result) @mock.patch.object(http.VersionNegotiationMixin, '_parse_version_headers', autospec=True) def test_negotiate_version_server_no_version(self, mock_pvh): mock_pvh.return_value = (None, None) conn = mock.MagicMock() resp = None result = self.test_object.negotiate_version(conn, resp) self.assertEqual(None, result) @mock.patch.object(http.VersionNegotiationMixin, '_parse_version_headers', autospec=True) def test_negotiate_version_server_no_version_on_error(self, mock_pvh): mock_pvh.side_effect = iter([(None, None), (1.1, 1.2)]) conn = mock.MagicMock() resp = None result = self.test_object.negotiate_version(conn, resp) self.assertEqual(1.2, result)

commit_message:
Honor uuid parameter passed to nova-network create

The nova api for creating nova-network networks has an optional
request parameter "id" which maps to the string uuid for the
network to create. The nova-manage network create command represents
it as the option --uuid. The parameter is currently being ignored
by the nova-network manager. This change sets the uuid when creating
the network if it has been specified.

Closes-Bug: #1441931

Change-Id: Ib29e632b09905f557a7a6910d58207ed91cdc047

commit_message:
Refactor nova-net cidr validation in prep for bug fix

The network manager create_networks function is on the verge of the
"too complex" pep8 check error, so this change refactors the cidr
validation code out into a private function in preparation for
fixing a bug.

Change-Id: Id0603ddd642acccfa12ae53a52ecfb66dca53702
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/171912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _validate_cidr(self, context, subnets_v4, fixed_net_v4): # NOTE(jkoelker): This replaces the _validate_cidrs call and # prevents looping multiple times try: nets = objects.NetworkList.get_all(context) except exception.NoNetworksFound: nets = [] used_subnets = [net.cidr for net in nets] def find_next(subnet): next_subnet = subnet.next() while next_subnet in subnets_v4: next_subnet = next_subnet.next() if next_subnet in fixed_net_v4: return next_subnet for subnet in list(subnets_v4): if subnet in used_subnets: next_subnet = find_next(subnet) if next_subnet: subnets_v4.remove(subnet) subnets_v4.append(next_subnet) subnet = next_subnet else: raise exception.CidrConflict(cidr=subnet, other=subnet) for used_subnet in used_subnets: if subnet in used_subnet: raise exception.CidrConflict(cidr=subnet, other=used_subnet) if used_subnet in subnet: next_subnet = find_next(subnet) if next_subnet: subnets_v4.remove(subnet) subnets_v4.append(next_subnet) subnet = next_subnet else: raise exception.CidrConflict(cidr=subnet, other=used_subnet) return nets nets = self._validate_cidr(context, subnets_v4, fixed_net_v4)

commit_message:
Remove EC2 test case that incompatible with Amazon

This test tries to allocate address and disassociate it without association.
Amazon allows to do it for EC2-classic and does not throw error.
But EC2 implementation in Nova throws error.
We have the same test in our own test suite against stackforge/ec2-api
(but it's not merged yet) and I checked it against Amazon -
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/171050/

I suggest to remove this test from tempest as incompatible with Amazon.
Also because of EC2 is deprecated in nova and can't be fixed.

Change-Id: I711314408ec7c4ea75f93348a7335843713e9a2b

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import test from tempest.thirdparty.boto import test as boto_test class EC2NetworkTest(boto_test.BotoTestCase): @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(EC2NetworkTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.ec2_client = cls.os.ec2api_client # Note(afazekas): these tests for things duable without an instance @test.idempotent_id('48b912af-9403-4b4f-aa69-fa76d690a81f') def test_disassociate_not_associated_floating_ip(self): # EC2 disassociate not associated floating ip ec2_codes = self.ec2_error_code address = self.ec2_client.allocate_address() public_ip = address.public_ip rcuk = self.addResourceCleanUp(self.ec2_client.release_address, public_ip) addresses_get = self.ec2_client.get_all_addresses( addresses=(public_ip,)) self.assertEqual(len(addresses_get), 1) self.assertEqual(addresses_get[0].public_ip, public_ip) self.assertBotoError(ec2_codes.client.InvalidAssociationID.NotFound, address.disassociate) self.ec2_client.release_address(public_ip) self.assertAddressReleasedWait(address) self.cancelResourceCleanUp(rcuk)

commit_message:
Enable hacking check H104

* [H104] Files with no code shouldn’t contain any license
         header nor comments, and must be left completely empty.

Change-Id: Ifedda6947bc9376533a19ded9fc6a70fd147f66f

commit_message:
accept languagepack name or uuid when prompting during 'app create'

During 'app create', we list and prompt for a languagepack if one
is not given using the --lp flag or in the planfile.

At this point, we only accept LP names, we should accept uuids as
well, just like in the planfile.

Change-Id: I9ebeb056475bcb46158d83e3dfd9ab1c339c5d38
Closes-bug: 1441886

commit_message:
Libvirt: preallocate_images CONFIG can be arbitrary characters

We can now set preallocate_images as any characters as long as it is
not equal to 'none' to enable preallocate images function, this is
too bad.

This patch changes the condition to equal to 'space'/'Space'/'SPACE'

Closes-Bug: 1427092
Change-Id: Ie8f4861fb77d2c3c3a8976fb7768ced12e7d8d5b

commit_message:
Agent driver fails without Ironic-managed TFTP

There are a lot of assumptions that Ironic has local PXE files.
This is untrue for deployments with separate DHCP servers and
agent images not hosted in Glance. Adds a new config option
'manage_tftp' in the DCHP section to disable TFTP management.

Closes-Bug: #1440896
Change-Id: Ibf5a415e3beee13d12e65e177816256df57cb423

added_lines: def test_connot_add_or_remove_role_on_disabled_domain(self): domain = self.new_domain_ref() self.assignment_api.create_domain(domain['id'], domain) self.assignment_api.update_domain(domain['id'], {'enabled': False}) collection_url = ( '/domains/%(domain_id)s/users/%(user_id)s/roles/%(role_id)s' % { 'domain_id': domain['id'], 'user_id': self.user['id'], 'role_id': self.role['id']}) self.put(collection_url, expected_status=403) self.assignment_api.update_domain(domain['id'], {'enabled': True}) self.put(collection_url) self.assignment_api.update_domain(domain['id'], {'enabled': False}) self.delete(collection_url, expected_status=403) def test_cannot_add_or_remove_role_on_disabled_project(self): project = self.new_project_ref(domain_id=self.domain['id']) self.assignment_api.create_project(project['id'], project) self.assignment_api.update_project(project['id'], {'enabled': False}) collection_url = ( '/projects/%(project_id)s/users/%(user_id)s/roles/%(role_id)s' % { 'project_id': project['id'], 'user_id': self.user['id'], 'role_id': self.role['id']}) self.put(collection_url, expected_status=403) self.assignment_api.update_project(project['id'], {'enabled': True}) self.put(collection_url) self.assignment_api.update_project(project['id'], {'enabled': False}) self.delete(collection_url, expected_status=403)

commit_message:
use keystone v3 api to fetch revocation list

Currently, keystone v2.0 url is hardcoded to fetch revocation list.
However, we should chose the corresponding api according to the value
of auth_version.

Change-Id: I2cf97eadfd6e410b89d8ba50f81de2fa7ec68db9
Closes-Bug: #1379506

subject: Move reseller spec for Liberty release
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-06 17:08:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs/commit/657b886947a55a2cecb2143157d10f34f38c9002', 'message': 'Move reseller spec for Liberty release

We already have implemented the following features:

- A new field will be added to the project table to represent if that
  project has the domain feature;
- Update the domain operations to execute in the project table
- Allow create subdomain using a parent_id
- Migrate the domains for project table
- Drop domain table

Now in liberty release we want work to approve this features.

The other features mentioned in this spec will not be implemeted since
we need to discuss better in the next summit, there is:

- Migrate the role assignments for DomainUser and DomainGroups types.
- Provide dual scoped token for a project with domain feature

commit_message:
Move reseller spec for Liberty release

We already have implemented the following features:

- A new field will be added to the project table to represent if that
  project has the domain feature;
- Update the domain operations to execute in the project table
- Allow create subdomain using a parent_id
- Migrate the domains for project table
- Drop domain table

Now in liberty release we want work to approve this features.

The other features mentioned in this spec will not be implemeted since
we need to discuss better in the next summit, there is:

- Migrate the role assignments for DomainUser and DomainGroups types.
- Provide dual scoped token for a project with domain feature

previously-approved: kilo

Change-Id: If357f38a8d81b094f47cd1a055dbec7edfb945ae
Implements: bp reseller

commit_message:
move tasks to after the dictionary updates

The tasks added to the task table needs to have the latest
info after all of the updates to the data. This fix ensures that
is the case for a few places that where missed.

Change-Id: I58abe55a5fab54f038637398455855c140141622
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Add compute RPC API v4.0

This patch creates compute RPC API version 4.0, while retaining
compatibility in rpcapi and manager for 3.x, allowing for
continuous deployment scenarios.

UpgradeImpact - Deployments doing continuous deployment should follow this
process to upgrade without any downtime:

1) Set [upgrade_levels] compute=kilo in your config.

2) Upgrade to this commit.

3) Once everything has been upgraded, remove the entry in
   [upgrade_levels] so that all rpc clients to the nova-compute service
   start sending the new 4.0 messages.

Change-Id: Id96e77c739e7473774e110646204520d6163d8a5

commit_message:
Switch to using oslo_* instead of oslo.*

The oslo team is recommending everyone to switch to the
non-namespaced versions of libraries. Updating the hacking
rule to include a check to prevent oslo.* import from
creeping back in.

$ find . -type f  -print | xargs sed -i 's/oslo\./oslo_/g'

Change-Id: I1dc6d9f68e6757e0b22820e8021cac782a6665ed

commit_message:
Update L3 Agent Scheduler API tests

Changes [1,2] recently merged in temptest. Change [2] in particular
is required if we run the API tests with DVR enabled, because now the
binding logic has been altered by [3].

This patch ensure that should that happen, the API job doesn't fail.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169895/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/165246/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/154289/

Change-Id: Iead1b90030098139090ae6ad4b77f50068817083
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/94/171794/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.tests.tempest import exceptionsAGENT_TYPE = 'L3 agent' AGENT_MODES = ( 'legacy', 'dvr_snat' ) _agent_mode = 'legacy' def skip_checks(cls): super(L3AgentSchedulerTestJSON, cls).skip_checks() @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(L3AgentSchedulerTestJSON, cls).resource_setup() # TODO(armax): falling back on default _agent_mode can be # dropped as soon as Icehouse is dropped. agent_mode = ( agent['configurations'].get('agent_mode', cls._agent_mode)) if agent['agent_type'] == AGENT_TYPE and agent_mode in AGENT_MODES: msg = "L3 Agent Scheduler enabled in conf, but L3 Agent not found" raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration(msg) cls.router = cls.create_router(data_utils.rand_name('router')) # NOTE(armax): If DVR is an available extension, and the created router # is indeed a distributed one, more resources need to be provisioned # in order to bind the router to the L3 agent. # That said, let's preserve the existing test logic, where the extra # query and setup steps are only required if the extension is available # and only if the router's default type is distributed. if test.is_extension_enabled('dvr', 'network'): is_dvr_router = cls.admin_client.show_router( cls.router['id'])['router'].get('distributed', False) if is_dvr_router: cls.network = cls.create_network() cls.create_subnet(cls.network) cls.port = cls.create_port(cls.network) cls.client.add_router_interface_with_port_id( cls.router['id'], cls.port['id']) self.router['id']) body = ( self.admin_client.list_l3_agents_hosting_router(self.router['id'])) self.router['id'])
deleted_lines: def resource_setup(cls): super(L3AgentSchedulerTestJSON, cls).resource_setup() # Trying to get agent details for L3 Agent if agent['agent_type'] == 'L3 agent': msg = "L3 Agent not found" raise cls.skipException(msg) name = data_utils.rand_name('router1-') router = self.client.create_router(name) self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_router, router['router']['id']) router['router']['id']) body = self.admin_client.list_l3_agents_hosting_router( router['router']['id']) del l3_agent_ids[:] router['router']['id'])

commit_message:
Launch Instance Step - Key Pair Import

This adds key pair creation and importing to Launch Instance.

Closes-Bug: #1433826

commit_message:
Add some tests for the error path(s) in RBD cleanup_volumes()

This code depends on a module which is not always present, and thus is
a little tricky to test, given exceptions missing from that module. This
patch adds a few tests to validate that error path.

Change-Id: I03e9376d956c70ced60e5bee32b4598f7b34d0d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/169333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(rbd_utils, 'rbd') @mock.patch.object(rbd_utils, 'rados') @mock.patch.object(rbd_utils, 'RADOSClient') def _test_cleanup_exception(self, exception_name, mock_client, mock_rados, mock_rbd): instance = objects.Instance(id=1, uuid='12345') setattr(mock_rbd, exception_name, test.TestingException) rbd = mock_rbd.RBD.return_value rbd.remove.side_effect = test.TestingException rbd.list.return_value = ['12345_test', '111_test'] client = mock_client.return_value self.driver.cleanup_volumes(instance) rbd.remove.assert_called_once_with(client.ioctx, '12345_test') def test_cleanup_volumes_fail_not_found(self): self._test_cleanup_exception('ImageNotFound') def test_cleanup_volumes_fail_snapshots(self): self._test_cleanup_exception('ImageHasSnapshots') def test_cleanup_volumes_fail_other(self): self.assertRaises(test.TestingException, self._test_cleanup_exception, 'DoesNotExist')

commit_message:
Update testing docs

The testing docs had gotten out of sync with the test code.

Change-Id: I523579b4cccafe0630e1116746f16d31aa94ed1b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/53/161553/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Not all of the tests in the keystone/tests/unit directory are strictly unit tests. Keystone intentionally includes tests that run the service locally and drives the entire configuration to achieve basic functional testing. For the functional tests, an in-memory key-value store or sqlite database is used to keep the tests fast. Within the tests directory, the general structure of the backend tests is a basic set of tests represented under a test class, and then subclasses of those:class:`~keystone.tests.unit.test_backend.IdentityTests` that will work with the default drivers as configured in this project's etc/ directory. ``test_backend_sql.py`` subclasses those tests, changing the configuration by overriding with configuration files stored in the ``tests/config_files`` directory aimed at enabling the SQL backend for the Identity module. :class:`keystone.tests.unit.test_v2_keystoneclient.ClientDrivenTestCase` uses the installed python-keystoneclient, verifying it against a temporarily running local keystone instance to explicitly verify basic functional testing across the API.To add tests covering all drivers, update the base test class in ``test_backend.py``.``keystone/tests/unit/test_ldap_livetest.py`` and ``keystone/tests/unit/test_ldap_pool_livetest.py``. The default password is ``test`` but if you have installed devstack with a different LDAP password, modify the file ``keystone/tests/unit/config_files/backend_liveldap.conf`` and ``keystone/tests/unit/config_files/backend_pool_liveldap.conf`` to reflect your password. To run the live tests you need to set the environment variable ``ENABLE_LDAP_LIVE_TEST`` to a non-negative value.The :func:`keystone.tests.unit.utils.wip` decorator can be used to mark a test as WIP. A WIP test will always be run. If the test fails then a TestSkippedThe :func:`~keystone.tests.unit.utils.wip` decorator requires that the author provides a message. This message is important because it will tell other developers why this test is marked as a work in progress. Reviewers will require that these messages are descriptive and accurate. The :func:`~keystone.tests.unit.utils.wip` decorator is not a replacement for skipping tests.
deleted_lines: Not all of the tests in the tests directory are strictly unit tests. Keystone intentionally includes tests that run the service locally and drives the entire configuration to achieve basic functional testing. For the functional tests, an in-memory key-value store is used to keep the tests fast. Within the tests directory, the general structure of the tests is a basic set of tests represented under a test class, and then subclasses of those``IdentityTests`` that will work with the default drivers as configured in this projects etc/ directory. ``test_backend_sql.py`` subclasses those tests, changing the configuration by overriding with configuration files stored in the tests directory aimed at enabling the SQL backend for the Identity module. Likewise, ``test_v2_keystoneclient.py`` takes advantage of the tests written against ``KeystoneClientTests`` to verify the same tests function through different drivers and releases of the Keystone client. The class ``CompatTestCase`` does the work of checking out a specific version of python-keystoneclient, and then verifying it against a temporarily running local instance to explicitly verify basic functional testing across the API.To add tests covering all drivers, update the relevant base test class (``test_backend.py``, ``test_legacy_compat.py``, and ``test_keystoneclient.py``).``keystone/tests/test_ldap_livetest.py`` and ``keystone/tests/test_ldap_pool_livetest.py``. The default password is ``test`` but if you have installed devstack with a different LDAP password, modify the file ``keystone/tests/config_files/backend_liveldap.conf`` and ``keystone/tests/config_files/backend_pool_liveldap.conf`` to reflect your password. To run the live tests you need to set the environment variable ``ENABLE_LDAP_LIVE_TEST`` to a non-negative value.The ``keystone.tests.util.wip`` decorator can be used to mark a test as WIP. A WIP test will always be run. If the test fails then a TestSkippedThe ``wip`` decorator requires that the author provides a message. This message is important because it will tell other developers why this test is marked as a work in progress. Reviewers will require that these messages are descriptive and accurate. The ``wip`` decorator is not a replacement for skipping tests.

commit_message:
Add deprecated_for_removal support to the config generator

When an option is deprecated for removal, the sample config file
should mention it, too.

Change-Id: Ide213b8c0783a128c7c4f7123d1cd2965588a81a

commit_message:
Set production oriented Ceph configuration parameters

Set production oriented Ceph configuration parameters to increase the
Ceph performance in proper place:
* rbd cache = true
* rbd cache writethrough until flush = true

Change-Id: Ic7cf72a4f390ce692fac9bf44bb481c412b370f8
Closes-bug: #1374969

commit_message:
Accept application ports as a flag during 'app create'

The 'app create' command does not accept application
port as a flag. We accept all other mandatory fields this way.

Closes-bug: 1441880
Change-Id: I2f50290b6cec49008742d67c54f396bfc29bdfc2

commit_message:
IBP Increased image building timeout up to 3600

When testing on a VM with low-performance disks
it is not always possible to build image in 1200
because dpkg does a lot of IO operations.

Change-Id: Ibf73a40e5c58ec15fddf1c85a13d7f9ce3001694
Closes-Bug: #1441679

commit_message:
Fixing the broken functional tests

Adding creator_id for Secret and Order types
Adding sub_status and sub_status_message for Order types
This is a result of these attributes being added to the API.
This change isn't aimed to support these fields, but rather just
accepts the data so that it won't bork the tests. Actual support
for using these fields should be addressed in a follow-up patch.

Fixes bug 1441848
Change-Id: I2340b7dd1dae3806418fa99bdaad73860dda5fbc

commit_message:
Increase minimum token life required

MIN_TOKEN_LIFE_SECONDS is the number of seconds that the token provided
must be valid for to be used when making authentication requests. 1
second has always been a dumb number and was not based on any existing
value.

Because a user token may be reused by a service to make requests on
behalf of a user if the token is valid when sent it may not be valid for
the life of the request.

2 minutes is also an arbitrary value, but it should allow plenty of time
for service requests to complete before being rejected.

Closes-Bug: #1441910
Change-Id: I395a0770e72d1ec7904e656ca382a5270f793a8b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/47/169947/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MIN_TOKEN_LIFE_SECONDS = 120

commit_message:
Fix string formatting in example

According to oslo.i18n guidelines % operator shouldn't be used for
log messages formatting. Translations should be formatted by passing
variable (or variables) as second parameter of LOG method.

Change-Id: I93e5348d469d125383f831841845ec23a8bf59a1
Closes-Bug: 1437211
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/hacking refs/changes/69/168269/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = _LE("Missing parameter: %s") LOG.error(msg, "flavor") LOG.error(msg, {"s_id": "1234", "m_key": "imageId"})

subject: Fixes glance-manage exporting meta definitions issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-23 16:19:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/5c0495fd8d91bb5d33705d5272ec9bac8710c49b', 'message': 'Fixes glance-manage exporting meta definitions issue

While using glance-manage db_export_metadefs the command fails
with NoSuchColumnError for column 'name'. The issue is with calling
function _export_data_to_file populating the values for
resource_type_associations. This resource_type_associations expect
one of the fields as 'name' whereas the function call _get_resource_type
is returning an 'id'. Modified the _get_resource_type method to return
a 'name' instead of 'id'.

I could have also added a new method to get resource type but the blueprint
"https://github.com/openstack/glance-specs/blob/master/specs/juno/metadata-
schema-catalog.rst" says a resource type has to be for example
OS::Glance::Image. So in my opinion _get_resource_type should return field
'name' instead of 'id' and hence the change.

Change-Id: I1fb3f8eb60fec354d4897debd9034bf61d1a57b4
Closes-Bug: #1434237
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-09 14:47:50.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/sqlalchemy/metadata.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/fe7ef09b3808509e010048184fa8d5acbf8312e5', 'message': "Fixes glance-manage exporting meta definitions issue

While using glance-manage db_export_metadefs the command fails
with NoSuchColumnError for column 'name'. The issue is with calling
function _export_data_to_file populating the values for
resource_type_associations. This resource_type_associations expect
one of the fields as 'name' whereas the function call _get_resource_type
is returning an 'id'. Modified the _get_resource_type method to return
whole resource type object.

Change-Id: I1fb3f8eb60fec354d4897debd9034bf61d1a57b4
Closes-Bug: #1434237
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes glance-manage exporting meta definitions issue

While using glance-manage db_export_metadefs the command fails
with NoSuchColumnError for column 'name'. The issue is with calling
function _export_data_to_file populating the values for
resource_type_associations. This resource_type_associations expect
one of the fields as 'name' whereas the function call _get_resource_type
is returning an 'id'. Modified the _get_resource_type method to return
whole resource type object.

Change-Id: I1fb3f8eb60fec354d4897debd9034bf61d1a57b4
Closes-Bug: #1434237

commit_message:
Update compute version alias for kilo

This simply draws a line in the sand for the version of compute RPC that
kilo supports for use during upgrades by operators.

Change-Id: I29103861e2e333cc877204cca62e2f26d3fafe66

commit_message:
Set version cap of neutronclient Juno to <2.4.0

Kilo neutronclient will be 2.4.0 (not 3.x).
This commit changes the version cap of neutornclient to <2.4.0
to keep a room for bug fixes for Juno.
The versioning follows the new stable branch versioning policy.

Change-Id: I467e8a42d4c1eace95775dfa3c4ca4d82326507f

commit_message:
Create Barbican python scripts for development.

This script does not require uwsgi and instead uses paste deploy to run Barbican.

Change-Id: I4a0148ad081fb8e238528af4eb54da8f0dfb037f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/61/170961/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python from paste import deploy from paste import httpserver def run(): prop_dir = 'etc/barbican' application = deploy.loadapp( 'config:{prop_dir}/barbican-api-paste.ini'.format(prop_dir=prop_dir), name='main', relative_to='.') httpserver.serve(application, host='127.0.0.1', port='9311') if __name__ == '__main__': run()
